title: ICE with incorrect use of `box (...) ...` syntax

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
``` rust
fn main() {
    box ( () ) 0;
}
```

```
boxerror.rs:2:5: 2:17 error: only the managed heap and exchange heap are currently supported
boxerror.rs:2     box ( () ) 0;
                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: no type for expr in fcx 0x7f86a744d1f0
note: the compiler hit an unexpected failure path. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://static.rust-lang.org/doc/master/complement-bugreport.html
```
